News from the Frontlines of Reform

From the Capitol to the cellblock, these are the stories of our work—and the people who make it possible.

Spring 2025: SB 1507 Signed, Oversight Office Launches

On March 21, 2025, Governor Katie Hobbs signed SB 1507, establishing the Office of Independent Correctional Ombudsman. The bill, prime-sponsored by Sen. Shawnna Bolick (R-District 20) with support from Sen. Analise Ortiz (D-District 24), creates an autonomous oversight body with investigation authority, record access, and facility inspection powers. Our Independent Prison Oversight team provided key testimony and will publish its first parallel inspection report in June, focusing on ASPC-Perryville with interviews from 50 incarcerated women.

In legislative news, our coalition's work during the ADCRR Sunset Review prevented the agency from obscuring constitutional violations. Despite ADCRR's $1.77 billion budget and $30 million spent on private legal defense, federal courts have held them accountable for violating Eighth Amendment rights. Our Criminal Legal System Reform team continues pushing for probation reform and sentencing reform in the 2026 session.

Our ARTS in Prison & Think Motion program received national attention for its peer-led workshops. The program currently operates in multiple facilities, with teaching artists—most formerly incarcerated—facilitating music, visual arts, and movement classes that build skills for post-release advocacy.

Returning Citizens Lead the Charge

Three Praxis Core Civics & Advocacy Training graduates have taken leadership roles in state policy discussions. Training participants have testified 47 times before legislative committees, secured seats on the Governor's Reentry Taskforce, and launched grassroots organizations. Our model proves that directly impacted leadership changes outcomes.

The Drug Policy & Overdose Prevention team distributed 2,000 naloxone kits in Q1 2025 through community partners in Maryvale and South Tucson. We documented 47 overdose reversals and connected 89 people to treatment. Our latest report, "Harm Reduction in the Hood: Year One Data," shows peer-led outreach is three times more effective than traditional referral services.

Press Coverage & Media Mentions

Arizona Capitol Times (June 22, 2025): "From Prison to Policy: How John Fabricius and Praxis Initiative Won Oversight" – Profile of our co-founder's journey and SB 1507 victory.

KJZZ (2025): "Arizona Creates Independent Prison Oversight Office" – Coverage of legislative passage and Praxis Initiative's role.

Reason.com (July 11, 2025): "Arizona Lawmakers Defund Prison Oversight Office They Just Created" – Analysis of funding challenges facing the new Ombudsman.

We've also been featured in Arizona Republic, Phoenix New Times, and PBS NewsHour for our prison health care advocacy. Our team regularly contributes op-eds and expert commentary on criminal justice issues.
